intro: Petasites hybridus subsp. hybridus, commonly known as the giant buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter, and its showy, yellow flowers that appear in early spring. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is known for its extensive rhizomatous growth. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine, though the plant contains toxic compounds that require careful handling.
